moving

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ability, Body, Foot, Head, PotionJar, Weapon

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages and stores all values for an Item. This particular class is a generic "shell" for an item. Classes that extend this class get into more particular items, such as PotionJar and RangedWeapon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String name,
    java.lang.String description,
    int xOnMap,
    int yOnMap,
    boolean isOnMap,
    java.awt.Image img)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        description - The item's description.
        xOnMap - The x-location of the item on the map, if it is on the map.
        yOnMap - The y-location of the item on the map, if it is on the map.
        isOnMap - Whether the item is on the map or not.
        img - The Image of the item.

    • Method Detail

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(Game myGame)
        Updates the item's position and checks for collision.
        Parameters:
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.

      • drawItemDescription

        public void drawItemDescription(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Draws the item description (the box that appears when you hover over an item with your mouse in the game).
        Parameters:
        g - The object on which to draw the graphics.
        x - The x coordinate to draw the item description at.
        y - The y coordinate to draw the item description at.

      • export

        public java.lang.String export()
        Used for exporting the item to the map file. This is only used if the item is on the map.
        Returns:
        A String representing this item's data.
